intro: Pisonia linearibracteata, commonly known as the narrow bract pisonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific and Indian Oceans. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. Its fruit is a capsule that releases small, wind-dispersed seeds, aiding in its propagation across coastal and island habitats. Pisonia linearibracteata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, coastal environments.
